column4: when building your own kernel, how do you specify a custom uname?
xubuntu is nice
oh hey, I assume you are using xfce. curious, are you using lvm at all with thunar? Im here for a problem where my LV's don't show up, but nobody seems to be speaking up yet :(
are you booting from LVs or is this an external lv that you want to look at?

nah, its boot lvm. my /usr and /var work fine, but since I upgraded to 11.10 and switched to xfce, I dont have the list of lv's in the thunar file browser like I did in gnome (which worked fine in 11.10)

i can manually mount still just fine, and udisk enumeration shows everything is seen at least. but thunar doesn't show anyhting lvm related at all, and I enabled "enable logical volume management" in the prefs too
does it not show up even after after it is manually mounted
I should mention though that it seems gnome has control of my desktop itself instead of xfce, so im wondering if naut is hijacking something that is causing the problem
no, one of my volumes is mounted now from lvm and its not in the list (short of me browsing to the /media mount point for it)
was it ever working through thunar?
it soundds like you installed xubuntu and then later installed some gnome suite
don't know, I originally install this as a 9.x install, and upgraded over the years. it wasn't until yesterday that I got 11.10 and switched to xfce and noticed it

originally this was a stock ubuntu install, with manual apt-get of xfce4 years ago. seems xfce might be missing something or conflicting with gnome somehow, but not sure other than to try remove gnome
does thunar even output anything incriminating when you run it in the terminal
is there any virtual package that you know of that would turn a stock ubuntu into xubuntu? in case im missing some depends or other. and sec, ill look at console output
there may be some hook that gnome has tekon over
not that I am aware of; the best way to get xubuntu is to install xubuntu...
ya, seems so. as for running "thunar", it just returns to console and no stderr output at all
well I suppose im due for a nice fresh install soon anyways :) thx for help though
Have you seen this? I actually had a near-identical issue several years back but I completely forget how I solved it; this may go through it https://bbs.archlinux.org/viewtopic.php?id=130748
tried a few things from there, no luck still. thanks anyways though
oh btw, got it working fine after installing xubuntu-desktop, my LVs in thunar that is. thanks again though :)
